original_title: Sri Lanka bond market quiet ahead of holiday season
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT-  Sri Lanka’s bond market was quiet at open ahead of the New Year holidays as investors slowed down activity, dealers said on Wednesday, and the rupee was steady at open in the spot market.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 26.00 percent down from at 27.45/75 percent on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2025 was also quoted at 26.00 down from 25.75/95 percent a day earlier.
“The rates came down to 25 percent after the Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe’s comments on local debt restructuring on April 6,2023,” a dealer said.
“After that the trading is done one percent up from that at 26 percent”.
The rupee was quoted at 319/320.30 to the US dollar in the spot market and the business was done around 320 to the US dollar dealers said.
The rupee closed at 319.50/320 rupees against the US dollar on Tuesday. (Colombo/Apr12/2023)
